intro: Descurainia chubutica, commonly known as the Chubut tansy, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnate leaves. The plant is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It has been studied for its potential medicinal properties and its role in ecological restoration projects due to its hardy nature.
